description.en:
The topics covered during the spring term include: 
1) contract law (the main concepts and terms of contract law, comparison of Estonian and English contract law, a model contract, and practical translation tasks)
2) basic principles and terms of law of succession in Estonia and the UK
3) basic principles and terms of family law in Estonia and the UK

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to prepare students for independent work with legal texts as well as communication with foreign colleagues and clients in various realms of law; practice explaining Estonian law and the meaning of legal notions to foreigners, and discuss legal problems in English.

description.et:
Topics addressed during the spring term:
1. Principles of legal translation introduced by a professional translator (guest lecturer)
 2. Contract law in the UK (basic terms e.g. void vs voidable contracts + Carbolic Smoke Ball case)
3. Law of obligations in Estonia  (basic terms e.g. formation, offer, acceptance, etc + a case study from Estonia)
4. Detailed study of a sample Distribution Agreement 
5. 2 practical contract translation tasks (ENG-EST-ENG)
6. Harmonization of European Contract Law (detailed study of useful terms/phrases in an academic article)
7. Basic concepts and terms in Trust Law
8. Basic concepts and terms of the Law of Succession (in the UK and Estonia incl student presentations)
9.Basic concepts and terms of Family law (in the UK and Estonia incl student presentations)

audience.et: Magistriõppe üliõpilased ja päevaõppe viimase kursuse üliõpilased
